channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Elon Musk Says He’s Removing ‘Sustainable’ From Tesla’s Mission
item.description: The future is "amazing," it's not necessarily sustainable.

item.title: ‘Zombie Stars’ Might Be a Beacon in Our Search for Dark Matter
item.description: To answer odd questions, physicists have odd ideas.

item.title: As people look for ways to make new friends, here are the apps promising to help
item.description: We've compiled a list of friendship apps, from friend discovery platforms like BFF to event-focused ones like Timeleft.

item.title: How RGB Mini-LED will transform the premium TV landscape in 2026
item.description: Mini-LED TVs that use RGB backlighting tech will arrive in a wider range of screen sizes from a wide array of brands in 2026. Should OLED TVs be worried?

item.title: Apple's iPad in 2025: the highs, lows, and what we want to see in 2026
item.description: Apple’s 2025 iPad lineup wasn’t about flashy redesigns, but meaningful performance upgrades and the arrival of iPadOS 26 combined to deliver the most complete iPad experience yet.

item.title: Rodeo is an app for making plans with friends you already have
item.description: There are plenty of dating apps out there, and apps that turn your chaos of work obligations into easily actionable lists. There is also a growing number of apps that help you make new friends. The pitch for Rodeo is a bit different in that it uses AI to help you schedule activities with your […]

item.title: South Park Writer Snagged ‘Trump-Kennedy Center’ Web Domains Months Ago
item.description: The writer has made a habit of acquiring official-sounding domains for satirical purposes.

item.title: The Truth About the ‘Stranger Things’ Upside Down Was in Place Back in Season 1
item.description: However, viewers were kept in the dark until season five's second batch of episodes, now streaming on Netflix.

item.title: Stocks hover at record highs after Christmas as gold and silver prices rise
item.description: Gold and silver prices continued to climb, with silver rising more than 7% to $76.88 an ounce. Stocks moved slightly lower in midday Friday trading as investors returned from the Christmas holiday. Trading is expected to be light.

item.title: Framework announces another memory price hike — and it likely won’t be its last
item.description: The modular PC company Framework is adjusting the price of its DDR5 RAM modules once again as the cost of memory continues to surge. In an update on Wednesday, Framework said it will charge $10 per GB for 8GB, 16GB, and 32GB, with "slightly higher" prices for the 48GB and up. Framework first announced a […]

item.title: What’s ahead for startups and VCs in 2026? Investors weigh in
item.description: VCs share their thoughts on what next year could bring to the market.

item.title: Fluffy rice and melt-in-your-mouth meats make the Ninja Foodi PossibleCooker my new favorite kitchen appliance
item.description: A rice cooker, slow cooker, stove, and steamer in one, this is the perfect multi-purpose kitchen appliance for any household.

item.title: Headed home after Christmas? A snowstorm could ground your flight
item.description: As winter weather alerts stretch from Pennsylvania to Connecticut, airports across the Northeast brace for possible delays and dangerous runway conditions. A number of airlines are waiving change fees ahead of what is expected to be a major winter storm forecast to hit the Northeast on Friday afternoon, affecting millions of people traveling after Christmas, during one of the busiest times of the year....

item.title: Xiaomi 17, 17 Pro, 17 Pro Max, 17 Ultra… Combien de smartphones va lancer Xiaomi en France ?
item.description: Après la présentation des Xiaomi 17, Xiaomi 17 Pro et 17 Pro Max puis du Xiaomi 17 Ultra, on peut se demander s'ils seront tous lancés en France.

item.title: These Smart Glasses Make Posting Straight to TikTok Less Annoying
item.description: Rokid is giving its new smart glasses more camera aspect ratio options so you won't have to crop for social media.

item.title: Why high-speed rail may not work the best in the U.S.
item.description: Not many U.S. cities have enough travel between them and are at the correct distance to support an investment in high-speed rail. High-speed rail systems are found all over the globe. Japan’s bullet train began operating in 1964. China will have 31,000 miles (50,000 kilometers) of high-speed track by the end of 2025. The fastest train in Europe goes almost 200 mph (320 kph). Yet high-speed rail remains absent from most of the U.S....

item.title: The Creative, Inspiring People We Lost in 2025
item.description: io9 remembers the sci-fi, fantasy, and horror standouts we sadly said goodbye to this year.

item.title: Apple won't make an iPhone Fold until foldables are perfect, so I don't think we'll ever see a foldable iPhone
item.description: Why play a flawed game when it can win without playing?

item.title: How to watch the Death in Paradise 2025 Christmas Special online from anywhere
item.description: When four friends wake after Christmas, a shocking murder changes everything. Here's how to watch the Death in Paradise 2025 Christmas special online from anywhere.
